class.name: AudioStreamBlipKitPlayback
class.brief_description: Audio stream to playback data from a BlipKit context.
class.description:
Allows to attach [BlipKitTrack] objects. [codeblocks] [gdscript] # Keep this object around. Freed tracks are detached from the stream playback. var track := BlipKitTrack.new()
# Some audio stream player with a [AudioStreamBlipKit] stream resource. var stream_player: AudioStreamPlayer = $AudioStreamPlayer
# Make sure the stream is playing or has [member AudioStreamPlayer.autoplay] set before retreiving the playback object. stream_player.play()
# Get the playback object. var playback: AudioStreamBlipKitPlayback = stream_player.get_stream_playback()
# Attach the track. track.attach(playback)
# Set some parameters and play a note. track.waveform = BlipKitTrack.WAVEFORM_TRIANGLE track.portamento = 8 track.note = BlipKitTrack.NOTE_A_2 [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: add_tick_function
method.description:
Adds a callback which is fired every multiple number of ticks (see [member AudioStreamBlipKit.clock_rate]). The callbacks are called in the same order as they are added. The callback function does not receive any argument and should return [code]0[/code]. If a value greater than [code]0[/code] is returned, the tick interval is changed to that value. This has the same effect as calling [method reset_tick_function] with a given tick count for this callback. [b]Note:[/b] The callback is fired first on the next tick after adding. [codeblocks] [gdscript] playback.add_tick_function(func () -> int: track.note += 1.0
# Change tick interval to 90. return 150 , 120) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: get_tick_function_count
method.description: Returns the number of tick callbacks.

method.name: remove_tick_function
method.description: Removes the tick callback at [param index].

method.name: reset_tick_function
method.description: Resets the tick counter of a tick callback at [param index] so that it fires on the next tick. If [param ticks] is greater than [code]0[/code], the tick interval is changed to that value.
